message_1: In a Beauty Contest Game with three players, the rules state that each player must choose a number between 0 and 100. The winner will be the player whose number is closest to two-thirds of the average of all three numbers. If all players know this, what number should each player choose to maximize their chances of winning?
message_2:
To maximize their chances of winning, each player should try to predict what the other players will choose and then choose a number that is two-thirds of the average of those predicted numbers.

Let's assume that all players choose a number between 0 and 100 randomly. The average of these numbers would be 50. Two-thirds of this average is 100/3, which is approximately 33.33. So, in the first round, a player might choose 33 to maximize their chances of winning.

However, if all players think this way, they will all choose 33. In this case, the average of the chosen numbers would be 33, and two-thirds of this average is 22. So, in the second round, a player might choose 22 to maximize their chances of winning.

This process can be repeated iteratively, with each player adjusting their choice based on the previous round's choices. As the iterations continue, the chosen numbers will converge to a Nash equilibrium, where no player can improve their chances of winning by changing their choice.

In this game, the Nash equilibrium occurs when all players choose 0. This is because if any player chooses a number greater than 0, the other players can choose a number closer to two-thirds of the average, which would be less than the chosen number, and win the game.

So, to maximize their chances of winning, each player should choose 0.
